flixel.util.loaders.CachedGraphics

type
class

Constructor

new(key : String, bitmap : flash.display.BitmapData, ?persist : Bool)

Instance Variables

assetsClass : Class<flash.display.BitmapData>

Class name for bitmapdata

assetsKey : String

Asset name from openfl.Assets

bitmap : flash.display.BitmapData

Cached BitmapData object

canBeDumped(accessor,null) : Bool

Says if bitmapdata of this Cache object can be dumped for less memory usage

data : TexturePackerData

TexturePackerData associated with bitmapdata

destroyOnNoUse : Bool

Whether we should destroy this CachedGraphics object when useCount become zero. Default if false.

isDumped(default,null) : Bool

Says if bitmapdata of this Cache object has been dumped or not

key : String

Key in BitmapFrontEnd cache

persist : Bool

Whether this Cached object should stay in cache after state change or not.

tilesheet(accessor,null) : flixel.system.layer.TileSheetData

useCount(accessor,accessor) : Int

Usage counter for this CachedGraphics object.

Instance Methods

destroy() : Void

dump() : Void

Dumps bits of bitmapdata = less memory, but you can't read / write pixels on it anymore (but you can call onContext() method which will restore it again)

getRegionForFrame(frameName : String) : TextureRegion

onContext() : Void

Use this method to restore cached bitmapdata (it it's possible). It's called automatically when RESIZE event occurs.

undump() : Void

Undumps bits of bitmapdata - regenerates it and regenerate tilesheet data for this object
